qas.question: When did the Mielnik Polish–Lithuanian union reform?
Where was the Mielnik Polish–Lithuanian union refromed?
Where was the  coronation Sejm founded?
What did the actof of milno do?

answers.text: more to strengthen the magnate dominated Senate of Poland then the lesser nobility

qas.question: What right was given to the nobles?

answers.text: disobey the King or his representatives

context: On <a0_0>23 October 1501<a0_0/>, at Mielnik Polish–Lithuanian union was reformed at the <a1_0><a2_0>Union of Mielnik<a2_0/><a1_0/> (Polish: unia mielnicka, unia piotrkowsko-mielnicka). It was there that the tradition of the coronation Sejm (Polish: "Sejm koronacyjny") was founded. Once again the middle nobility (middle in wealth, not in rank) attempted to reduce the power of the magnates with a law that made them impeachable before the Senate for malfeasance. However the Act of Mielno (Polish: Przywilej mielnicki) of 25 October did <a3_0>more to strengthen the magnate dominated Senate of Poland then the lesser nobility<a3_0/>. The nobles were given the right to <a4_0>disobey the King or his representatives<a4_0/>—in the Latin, "non praestanda oboedientia"—and to form confederations, an armed rebellion against the king or state officers if the nobles thought that the law or their legitimate privileges were being infringed.
